title: Ernest Jones (linebacker)
text:
Ernest Jones (born November 22, 1999) is an <a href="American%20football">American football</a> <a href="linebacker">linebacker</a> for the <a href="Los%20Angeles%20Rams">Los Angeles Rams</a> of the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> (NFL). He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="South%20Carolina%20Gamecocks%20football">South Carolina</a>.
Early life and high school.
Jones grew up in <a href="Waycross%2C%20Georgia">Waycross, Georgia</a> and attended <a href="Ware%20County%20High%20School">Ware County High School</a>. As a senior, he recorded 112 tackles with six tackles for loss, two sacks and three forced fumbles and was named first-team Class AAAAA. Jones committed to play at <a href="South%20Carolina%20Gamecocks%20football">South Carolina</a> after considering offers from <a href="Georgia%20Tech%20Yellow%20Jackets%20football">Georgia Tech</a> and <a href="Duke%20Blue%20Devils%20football">Duke</a>.
College career.
Jones played in five games a freshman with 16 tackles and a forced a fumble. He became a starter and led South Carolina with 97 tackles in his sophomore season. Jones missed most of South Carolina's preseason training due to an appendectomy. He led the team again as a junior with 86 tackles, five of which were for a loss. At the end of the season, Jones declared that he would forgo his senior season and enter the 2021 NFL draft.
Professional career.
Jones was selected in the third round with the 103rd overall pick of the <a href="2021%20NFL%20Draft">2021 NFL Draft</a> by the <a href="Los%20Angeles%20Rams">Los Angeles Rams</a>. Jones signed his four-year rookie contract with the Rams on July 22, 2021.
Jones entered his rookie season in 2021 as a backup inside linebacker behind <a href="Kenny%20Young%20%28American%20football%29">Kenny Young</a> and <a href="Troy%20Reeder">Troy Reeder</a>. He was inserted into the starting lineup after the Rams traded Young prior to Week 8. In Week 14 Jones intercepted a pass from <a href="Kyler%20Murray">Kyler Murray</a> in a 30-23 win over the <a href="Arizona%20Cardinals">Arizona Cardinals</a>. He suffered a high ankle sprain in Week 16 and was placed on injured reserve on December 28. He was activated on January 29, 2022 for the NFC Championship game. He finished the season with 61 tackles, one sack, four passes defensed, and two interceptions through 15 games and seven starts.
